Key Match Events: Kusal Mendis-led Sri Lanka registered their first win in the ongoing ICC Men's ODI World Cup 2023 by defeating the Netherlands by 5 wickets with 10 balls remaining.
Netherlands scored 262 runs in 49.5 overs and were all out. Sybrand Engelbrecht (70) and Logan van Beek (59) scored the most for the Dutch team.
Sri Lanka's Dilshan Madushanka and Kasun Rajitha took 4 wickets each, and Maheesh Theekshana picked one.
Chasing a target of 263, Sri Lankan batters started slow but picked up pace. Pathum Nissanka (54), Sadeera Samarawickrama (91*), and Charith Asalanka (44) made some quality partnerships.
Sri Lanka completed 250 runs in 45.5 overs (275 balls) and successfully chased 263-runs target in 48.2 overs.
Pre-Game Insights: The Netherlands won the toss and decided to bat first. This will be the first time the Dutch will bat first against Sri Lanka.
The team winning the toss may bowl first as the pitch is likely to favour bowlers, especially the slower ones.
Post-Match Reflections: With this, Sri Lanka moved a position up in the ICC points tally and is at number 9 with 2 points.
Despite winning against the Dutch team, Sri Lanka is below them due to Net Run Rate (NRR) difference. SL have played 4 matches as of yet and won just one.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dutch team, in their previous match, produced the tournament's second significant shock by defeating South Africa by 38 runs on October 17.
The Netherlands have now played 3 matches, winning 1 and losing 2.
On the contrary, despite their best efforts, Sri Lanka have lost all 3 matches so far.
The Netherlands and Sri Lanka have played 5 One-Day Internationals (ODIs) so far, with the Dutch failing to defeat Sri Lanka even once.
